    • Uses of ModelState in peril.model.states

      Subclasses of ModelState in peril.model.states 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Attack
      The logic of the ModelState where the current ModelPlayer can select any of their ModelCountrys and then a ModelCountry that is directly linked to the ModelPlayer that is ruled by an enemy ModelPlayer.
      class  Fortify
      The logic for the ModelState where current ModelPlayer can select one of their ModelCountrys then another provided that there is a path of friendly ModelCountrys between the two ModelCountry.
      class  Reinforce
      The logic for the ModelState where the current ModelPlayer can select one of their ModelCountrys and reinforce the ModelCountry's ModelArmy with ModelUnit(s).
      class  Setup
      The logic of the ModelState where the players decide which ModelPlayers rules each ModelCountry.
      Methods in peril.model.states that return ModelState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ModelState Test_Setup.TestGC.getCurrentState() 
      ModelState Test_Fortify.TestGC.getCurrentState() 
      ModelState Test_Attack.TestGC.getCurrentState() 

    • Uses of ModelState in peril.views

      Methods in peril.views with parameters of type ModelState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object ModelView.getVisual(ModelState state)
      Retrieves the visual counterpart to the specified ModelState.
      boolean View.isCurrentState(ModelState state)
      Retrieves whether or not the specified ModelState is the current ModelState that the View is displaying to the user.
